intro: Senecio morotonensis, commonly known as the Morotone groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Senecio morotonensis is often found in the Eastern Cape and Western Cape provinces of South Africa.
